item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

Hahaha. The VM spec tells quite clearly how to read the class format. I don’t need a prewritten version to adapt. If you’d like, take a look at BBL, my product of last summer. There is little to no influence contained therein from other people. Furthermore, if you’re using psb’s updater, do tell so. We don’t assume that you are using your god’s works.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“unlimitedorb, post:38, topic:190524”]Okay, both of you, learn to read thanks.

Reread the posts, read what was said and not said, and stop making up stuff. It reads bytes yes, it reads them correctly for java types. Having never seen this code before, and if I locked you in a room, you wouldn’t be able to produce it, this is fact. I know you’re ass buddies with frank, I’m more well informed than I come off… From what I was told “i like frank… i don’t know frank in real life… but i wish i did” (by you, if you’ve forgotten). This makes you a very sketchy character, creepy seems to be a more befitting term. I have no idea of the validity?

It’s psb’s updater, I posted the output, how on God’s green earth would I know the validity of someone else’s work. Then again, I see you and frank posting other peoples work all over… helps me to understand why both of you make comments and derail threads like this.

PSB fail on the wall. Yz85Racer. Lol. You’re a 14 year old who visits cheating sites instead of visiting that girlfriend you so desperately want but have never had; maybe if you too changed priorities. use proxies kthxbai

Oh snap, look at me, I pulled a frank_, I seem to have attacked you personally to compensate for personal shortcomings. Maybe next time I’ll be more mature. Nah, frank is proof I wont be banned, so who curs![/quote]
Umm, buddy. I am 13. Also, real life != moparisthebest.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“unlimitedorb, post:34, topic:190524”]Kind of interesting how something that consists of far less code, and is far more flexible, can operate just as quickly as something you spend over a year on.[/quote]if you believe i actually spent a year on it, you are an idiot
i started again a few days ago and finished recently

[quote=“ruler, post:27, topic:190524”]@frank_
You are wrong alot. You are quick to go to personal attacks. It is ok to be wrong, I make mistakes all the time. You need to learn how to apologize when you are wrong.[/quote]at least i am able to admit when i am wrong, in this case i am not

[quote=“RANCID, post:28, topic:190524”]Why the hell would you write a java bytecode library in C? God damn, I’ll bet that code is ugly.[/quote]to learn the language better, why else? and no, the code isnt ugly because i am not a moron

[quote=“unlimitedorb, post:24, topic:190524”]Oh really, I don’t know Aivars? How is his child doing?[/quote]i can ask other people questions too

[quote=“solarwind, post:33, topic:190524”]I couldn’t agree more about everything after the @frank part.[/quote]you still are and always will be an idiot

[quote=“Silver Lining, post:35, topic:190524”]I must contribute. That’s a wonderful piece of code, unlimitedorb. It reads bytes. Wow, fucking revolutionary. Secondly, oh my, Wikipedia must be correct! Surely a freely edited page cannot be wrong! You’re a doubleplus good duckspeaker for psb. On your second post, why say you edited the post when we can clearly see you didn’t? For fuck’s sake, at least refrain from thinking such a pointless thing would fool even a toddler. Next, saying “I have no idea of the validity” shows how amazingly ignorant you are. You have no idea? Shit, that’s a big fucking problem. Maybe if you could think for yourself and your thoughts were not shoddy replicas of what psb has said, you might be able to check. Again, I commend you for your excellent duckspeaking. I wouldn’t mind you so much if you were saying these things about yourself. But when you’re singing praises for someone else and never mentioning what you can do - that’s what pisses me off. Fly away from your fucked up nest, little fledgling, and be the hero, not the bard.[/quote]+1

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

[quote=“BAsh(CntLgn), post:29, topic:190524”]You can spend months making a c/c++ byte code phraser or you can use java ones instead and incur a 200ms penalty.

Shit. I don’t notice a 1sec penalty when my program starts up.[/quote]

Indeed. Look at java white papers, in actuality, c has been compared to operate near or about the same as java when compiling with the JIT compiler. CLARIFICATION (hotspot) JIT compiler

Kind of interesting how something that consists of far less code, and is far more flexible, can operate just as quickly as something you spend over a year on.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“ruler, post:27, topic:190524”]Using C for bytecode manipulation sounds counter-productive. I would consider advantages of using C# over Java just for the many language features, partical classes, pre-processor, LINQ for XML configs. However the time spent to gain the advantages over using pre-existing bytecode libs in Java is the real debate.

@frank_
You are wrong alot. You are quick to go to personal attacks. It is ok to be wrong, I make mistakes all the time. You need to learn how to apologize when you are wrong.[/quote]

I couldn’t agree more about everything after the @frank part.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 18, 2008, 08:10:12 PM[/size][hr][code]

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Fasga, post:31, topic:190524”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=253996.msg2119194#msg2119194 date=1205898008]
Months? I think you people are overestimating how difficult C++ is for simple tasks.

Sure, it has many pitfalls and sure writing a huge or obscure application in C++ can be the mother of all headaches, but uh… we’re talking about a bytecode library here, not the Linux kernel.
[/quote]
Linux kernel was written in C.[/quote]

Touche.

To most people in this thread though there seems to be no difference.

I mean shit, look at psb’s code.
